---
title: Quotes
aliases:
  - quotes.html
author: Marie-Hélène Burle
---

::: {.cell hash='intro_quotes_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_f64380c6f9be11d26f58651cf8011a8c'}

:::


:::{.def}



:::

Let's experiment with quotes:


::: {.cell hash='intro_quotes_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_c9d2e9908b4065a0bbe62ede758b0c92'}

```{.bash .cell-code}
variable=This string is the value of the variable
echo $variable
```


::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
bash: line 1: string: command not found
```
:::
:::


Oops...


::: {.cell hash='intro_quotes_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_4df6ff3e75d0a73cb298f31c1ef285b7'}

```{.bash .cell-code}
variable="This string is the value of the variable"
echo $variable
```


::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
This string is the value of the variable
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='intro_quotes_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_14a28a58568c6777dd0f540bad98d05b'}

```{.bash .cell-code}
variable='This string is the value of the variable'
echo $variable
```


::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
This string is the value of the variable
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='intro_quotes_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_7dfd4802d085b0ccd527287e8679a034'}

```{.bash .cell-code}
variable='This string's the value of the variable'
echo $variable
```


::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
bash: -c: line 1: unexpected EOF while looking for matching `''
```
:::
:::


Oops...

One solution to this is to use double quotes:


::: {.cell hash='intro_quotes_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-6_2f88fb1b21d57cefab7311225ffd0ba1'}

```{.bash .cell-code}
variable="This string's the value of the variable"
echo $variable
```


::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
This string's the value of the variable
```
:::
:::


Alternatively, single quotes can be escaped:


::: {.cell hash='intro_quotes_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-7_4dd9320448fbd6a13aa3d8b0a085e754'}

```{.bash .cell-code}
variable='This string'"'"'s the value of the variable'
echo $variable
```


::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
This string's the value of the variable
```
:::
:::


:::{.note}

Admittedly, this last one is a little crazy. It is the way to escape single quotes in single-quoted strings.

The first `'` ends the first string, both `"` create a double-quoted string with `'` (escaped) in it, then the last `'` starts the second string.

Escaping double quotes is a lot easier and simply requires `\"`.

:::
